p: The air-dried powder of the above-ground parts of the P. dioscoridis, and E. bonariensis, (200 gm, each) were subjected separately to Clevenger-type apparatuses using round flask (2.5 L) comtaining water (1.5 L) for hydro-distillation for 3 h. The oily layer of each plant was isolated separately by n-hexane, then dried using anhydrous Na 2SO 4 (0.5 g), and finally stored in glass vials in the freezer till further analysis via GC-MS. This extraction of the EO of each plant was repeated as duplicates.
